response: "{ \"title\": \"Counting Triangles\", \"description\": \"Given a list of integers representing the lengths of the sides of triangles, write a function `count_triangles` that counts the number of valid triangles.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef count_triangles(sides: List[int]) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `sides` (List[int]): A list of integers representing the lengths of the sides of triangles, where each length is at least 1 and at most 10^6.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the number of valid triangles that can be formed from the given side lengths.\\n\", \"code\": \"from typing import List\\n\\ndef count_triangles(sides: List[int]) -> int:\\n    sides.sort()\\n    count = 0\\n    for i in range(len(sides) - 2):\\n        k = len(sides) - 1\\n        for j in range(i + 1, k):\\n            if sides[i] < sides[j] + sides[k]:\\n                count += 1\\n                k -= 1\\n            else:\\n                break\\n    return count\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert count_triangles([3, 5, 2]) == 1\", \"assert count_triangles([10, 4, 7]) == 3\", \"assert count_triangles([1, 2, 3]) == 0\", \"assert count_triangles([5, 6, 8, 9, 1]) == 2\"] }"
